DOC.brief_summary: The specific aim of this study is to demonstrate that inserting a breathing tube using a standard laryngoscope with the patient fully anesthetized is a safe and effective means of securing the airway in a patient with cervical spine disk herniation or stenosis. The two groups compared are composed of those who are intubated with direct laryngoscopy and those who are intubated with a fiberoptic scope.
DOC.brief_title: The Effect of Intubation Method on Outcome of Cervical Spine Surgery
DOC.criteria: Over 18 years of age for cervical disk herniation or cervical spine surgery by either Drs Snow or Lavyne from 19982006. Unstable (broken) cervical spine
